programme.title: The Core (2003)
programme.desc: The Earth's core has stopped spinning. Disasters are happening around the globe, including; animals acting in bizarre ways, monstrous thunderstorms. Dr. Josh Keyes and his crew of 5 go down to the centre to set off a nuclear device, hoping to make the core start spinning again, or humanity will cease

programme.title: The Mask (1994)
programme.desc: Stanley Ipkiss (Jim Carrey) is a bank clerk that is an incredibly nice man. Unfortunately, he is too nice for his own good and is a pushover when it comes to confrontations. After one of the worst days of his life, he finds a mask that depicts Loki, the Norse night god of mischief. Now, when he puts it on, he becomes his inner, self: a cartoon romantic wild man. However, a small time crime boss, Dorian Tyrel (Peter Greene), comes across this character dubbed "The Mask" by the media. After Ipkiss's alter ego indirectly kills his friend in crime, Tyrel now wants this green-faced goon destroyed

programme.title: A Million Ways to Die in the West (2014)
programme.desc: Set in 1882 in the American west, Albert is a lowly farmer with a nice girlfriend. But when she leaves him for the more successful and handsome owner of a moustachery store, Albert returns to his lonely daily life of trying to avoid death. Then the mysterious Anna rides into town and captures Albert's interest and heart, but with her deadly husband in town, Albert is going to have to become the western gun-slinging hero he never was. It won't be easy because there are a million ways to die in the west

programme.title: EuroTrip (2004)
programme.desc: Dumped by his girlfriend, a high school grad decides to embark on an overseas adventure in Europe with his friends

programme.title: This Is the End (2013)
programme.desc: All Jay Baruchel expected coming to LA was a fun time with Seth Rogen with all the wild partying to have both by themselves and at James Franco's housewarming party. Suddenly, the Rapture hits and the Biblical Apocalypse has begun. Now, Jay and Seth are desperately sheltering in James' house for rescue along with a few other friends. Together, they must band together to attempt to survive the end of the world, only for Jay to find that they are all too dumb and superficial to do it until they discover the only way out

programme.title: George Carlin: Life Is Worth Losing (2005)
programme.desc: George Carlin continues making people laugh with his 13th HBO stand-up special

programme.title: Face the Beast
programme.desc: Andrew and Brian venture out to solve the mystery of the La Concepcion, a shipwreck near the Bahamas where over 300 men were eaten by sharks in 1563. To discover the truth of why the sharks attacked.(n)

programme.title: Au pays des Cajuns
programme.desc: As hunters travel deep into the swamp, Joey and Zak use an off-road buggy to chase a giant bull gator. Daniel and Big Tee journey by land to reach a far off honey hole, while Willie has an old score to settle in the eerie Black Lagoon.(n)

programme.title: Nos ancêtres les extraterrestres
programme.desc: Alien encounters have been documented in various historical texts, citing as evidence, the 13th century book Otia Imperialia which describes an incident in Bristol, England ascribed to UFOs.(n)

programme.title: Projet impossible
programme.desc: In the past 50 years, the world's energy use has doubled. In the next 50 years, it will double again. Across the world, engineers are going to extreme lengths to keep the lights on.(n)

programme.title: Face the Beast
programme.desc: On a small island off the coast of Myanmar, Andrew and Brian investigate the mystery of the Ramree Island massacre, where a thousand Japanese soldiers were slaughtered by man eating crocodiles.(n)

programme.title: Le convoi de l'extrême
programme.desc: An early thaw has drivers struggling to make it home over hard-hit trails, while two truckers reunite to pull a double trailer over a slick path. Later, a veteran races to deliver to a town before a road closes.(n)

programme.title: Big Rig Warriors
programme.desc: 'Sexy Jacquette' Lafleur fights through the pain of a broken foot in his final race of the season. Meanwhile, in Edmonton, Isaac Harder hopes to dethrone the current big rig drag race record-holder.(n)

programme.title: Big Rig Warriors
programme.desc: In Victoria BC, the Championship is up for grabs in the season's final oval race and Team Lucky 13 drivers have a shot at the crown. The defending champ has disappeared, but his truck has a new driver and is a top contender.(n)

programme.title: La guerre en mémoire
programme.desc: Canadians who served in four different wars (WWII, Korea, Bosnia & Afghanistan) tell their powerful personal stories of war and its lifelong costs and share the experience of combat.(n)

In the first edition of the two-part special, the team builds houses for two former soldiers who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan and are suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder. programme.desc: Upcycling entrepreneur EJ Osborne heads to Working Recycling Centre seeking to rescue and revamp three pieces of tip-bound trash. EJ has some racing tyres to rev his creative engine, but will all three transformations succeed in making a profit?(n)

programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock helps to create a sensory garden for two autistic girls in Aylesbury, while also providing a garden in Liphook for Anne, Shaun and their daughter Joanne.(n)

programme.desc: The second part of the documentary sees the chicks hatching in Antarctica, the Falklands and Peru, leading to delightful scenes as the new parents help their young take their first few unsteady steps. All three colonies share one thing in common, however - protecting their babies from predators eager to get hold of the new arrivals.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley is on his home patch in north London as he explores the Lea Valley, paying a visit to one of the UK's biggest salad growers to see what impact coronavirus is having. On International Dawn Chorus Day, bird expert Adrian Thomas reveals what to listen out for, shepherdess Hannah Jackson talks about how she's coping with the lockdown, and Adam Henson goes flat out to get his spring barley in.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a look at the complex social and family lives of the animal group, including leaf monkeys competing to babysit a bright orange infant and rally to defend it from a python, and gibbons learning daredevil treetop acrobatics with their playmates. programme.title: Killing Eve

programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Real Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Eight celebrities embark on an experimental adventure to India, to see whether they can set up a more rewarding life than in the UK. Enterpreneur Duncan Bannatyne, designer Zandra Rhodes, comedian Paul 'Chuckle' Elliott, cricket legend Henry Blofeld, former EastEnder John Altman, actresses Britt Ekland and Susie Blake and singer Barbara Dickson arrive at their new home by the sea in Puducherry, and while Britt struggles with the heat and Paul misses his missus, Susie, Barbara and Zandra bond over a bit of traditional Indian cooking.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: HealthCheck UK Live
programme.desc: Dr Xand van Tulleken and Michelle Ackerley guide viewers through the challenges of keeping mentally and physically healthy during the lockdown. Angela Rippon has her daily pick of thoughts and messages from the programme' inbox, and Mr Motivator presents another home workout.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters follow the development progress of a corner plot in Wallasey, Merseyside, a mid-terrace house in Hyde in Manchester and a bungalow in Great Barr, Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Our Finest Hours
programme.desc: As the UK faces its biggest challenge since the Second World War, Sophie Raworth looks at how the nation has responded to adversity in the past and in the present. Using a combination of wartime archive and contemporary news footage, each episode looks at the impact of Covid-19 on families, communities and businesses, and compares how the nation has responded to crisis now and then.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp is at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex and visits a unique collection at the Millennium Seed Bank, while David Harper and Raj Bisram help the teams.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ruhma is pleased by Zara's support at her review hearing, while Daniel is concerned when he realises an inmate is causing trouble so he can stay in prison to help someone out.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A day out at a local hill climb track ends with one of the drivers being killed. Father Brown persists with his personal investigation, and an infuriated Sullivan resolves to put an end to his meddling for good. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple looking for a home in the Wye Valley, and also examines the challenges of sustainably sourcing and restocking the European eel in the River Wye.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Consumers try out a smell-proof dog bag, a hand cream designed especially for nurses and a pirate-themed board game featuring 100 original characters.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Christina Trevanion set out from Morecambe to hunt for items to sell at an auction in Sheffield, but a messy encounter with a gull almost ruins one deal.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Coronavirus: When Will We Be Safe? - Panorama
programme.desc: As politicians decide how and when to lift the lockdown, Justin Rowlatt discovers how science can help defeat the coronavirus. With access to key drug and vaccine trials, he reveals a race against time to help save lives, and asks when people are likely to be able to return to a normal life.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gray and Max spring into action to rescue Whitney, who cannot believe what she is hearing when Michaela admits she knew what Tony was up to. The clubbers are horrified to see Bobby unconscious, but he soon wakes up and lies about what happened to protect Dotty. Isaac is dumbfounded by the news that Patrick is his father, Chantelle opens up to Kheerat and Kush worries about Jean.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Clare Balding, Asim Chaudhry, Victoria Coren Mitchell and Greg James join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As ever, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory.(n)

programme.title: Normal People
programme.desc: At a fundraising event at the club, one of Connell's friends Karen does her best to show Marianne some kindness, but Rachel behaves coldly towards her, and the evening turns sour when one of the boys' older friends gropes Marianne. Connell becomes anxious when his friends tease him about Marianne, suspecting they've guessed about their relationship. Fuelled by anxiety, he makes an unexpected decision that hurts Marianne and causes a rift between him and his mother Lorraine. Adaptation of Sally Rooney's novel, starring Paul Mescal and Daisy Edgar-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Famalam
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy sketch show, featuring a misunderstood superhero, Croydon's leading witch doctor, a raunchy morning chat show, a grime MC who is an expert in royal history, a preview of the latest Nigerian blockbuster movie, and some much-needed cultural diversity in Midsomer Murders.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Maisie Adam and James O'Brien joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host reviews trending news stories before connecting to star guests via the internet. Although there is no studio audience, the jokes and stories remain plentiful, while the notorious Red Chair feature remains - now relocated to the comfort of the viewers' own armchairs at home.(n)

programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.sub-title: Global Questions: Coronavirus Crisis: Our Economy
programme.desc: As the Coronavirus takes hold around the world, Global Questions invites its international audience to put their questions to a panel of experts on the impact on the Global Economy. With dire warning of the worst recession since the 1930's what will the fallout be? Are we mortgaging the future of the young for the sake of the old and will we see a return to big government intervention economics? Join Zeinab Badawi and two leading international figures answering your questions from around the world.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Two divers documenting a wreck in the Thames find more than they bargained for and call in the Royal Navy bomb team. An unsafe load on a vehicle flies off, landing on a windscreen.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Customers test out three new products, including a vegan skincare range, a coat for drying dogs, and a device designed to attach items of hand luggage together.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Compton Verney, Warwickshire. Finds include hand-painted fashion illustrations from the 1930s, a pair of bronze cockerels from Benin, West Africa, and a rare Chinese incense burner worth a small fortune. Fiona meets the granddaughter of the first British woman to win an individual swimming gold medal, at the 1924 Olympics, and military expert Mark Smith hears the story of how a First World War hero earned the Victoria Cross.(n)

programme.title: Kate Humble - Into the Volcano
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kate Humble joins a team of geologists on a research expedition to the Vanuatu archipelago in the southern Pacific, beginning at Mount Yasur on the island of Tanna, one of the most active volcanos in the world. To discover whether a devastating eruption might happen, the scientists need to collect a lava bomb the minute it is hurled from the crater and while they prepare for their mission, Kate explores the island and discovers how the volcano shapes the lives, traditions and beliefs of everyone who lives in its shadow.(n)

programme.title: Alex Polizzi: Chefs on Trial
programme.desc: The mission to find an executive head chef for Lake District restaurant The Gilpin continues. The last three candidates prepare a partridge fit for a fine-dining menu - and with only one place left in tomorrow's final, the pressure is on. While one of the chefs sets out to create something deserving of a Michelin star, another has trouble convincing the family he really wants the position, when it turns out he never stays in one job very long.(n)

programme.title: The War Lords
programme.desc: British historian AJP Taylor appraises the performance of the Second World War leaders, with this edition focusing on the role of Hitler during the conflict.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: John Higgins v Judd Trump. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the 2011 World Championship final, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team is in Old College, Aberystwyth University, on the west coast of Wales, where Christina Trevanion values a pair of Wedgwood plates, while a gold guinea impresses Raj Bisram.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Al Murray and Nish Kumar, presenter Anneka Rice and Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo continue the daily test of their general knowledge skills, hosted by Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: International sheepdog breeder David and farmer Brenda battle the temperamental British weather with their pedigree dogs by their sides, competing in Powburn, Northumberland, at one of Britain's oldest sheepdog trials.(n)

programme.title: Front Row Late
programme.desc: Mary Beard and her guests consider the effects of Covid-19 on the world of literature, asking whether isolation will lead to a post-pandemic rise in books. There is also a discussion on how writing and drama chronicled the HIV and Aids crisis of the 1980s and helped to shape public attitudes.(n)

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: Coniston Water isn't the biggest of Cumbria's lakes - but it's one of the most iconic and the place where Donald Campbell died trying to break the world water speed record. Paul meets Campbell's daughter Gina and crew member Robbie Robinson, who was there on the fateful day in January 1967 when Bluebird somersaulted and crashed on the water. The explorer also enters a Lakeland bike ride with a difference before ending his visit with a spot of rock climbing at Dow Crag before the ascent of one of the area's best known hills, The Old Man of Coniston.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Susan Calman presents as the Welsh chefs serve up their mains and desserts inspired by children's literature. The dishes include a Boggis, Bunce and Bean Farmers' Supper based on Fantastic Mr Fox, a guinea fowl inspired by the legend of Welsh dragon Y Ddraig Goch, a Willy Wonka golden egg and a simple marmalade sandwich in homage to everyone's favourite bear from darkest Peru, Paddington.(n)

programme.title: Devs
programme.desc: Stewart feels uptight when he is begged for a favour, especially as he has grave misgivings about Forest and the project. Lily is schooled in the ideas behind Devs, and later - when she emerges from heavy sedation - she realises it is not feasible to flee her problems. Instead she elects to make a house call, but does not get to question the person she expected.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Darren Harriott hosts the show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing stand-up performances by Jessica Fostekew and Stephen Bailey.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events.(n)

programme.title: Big Animal Surgery
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin enters the world of wild animal surgery, beginning at a sanctuary in South Africa, where she witnesses an extraordinary operation inside the jaws of a lion. Nine-year-old Ricci has problems with his teeth so severe that he is unable to feed properly. One of the world's leading vets is on hand to fix the problem, using an array of specially made tools. But things take a dangerous twist when the patient begins to wake up from the anaesthetic midway through.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Five talented amateurs compete to win a place in the finals. Each must cook an outstanding dish to win over four of the country's most feared restaurant critics - Grace Dent, William Sitwell, Jay Rayner and Jimi Famurewa. Serving food to these masters of the dining room is a daunting task for the most adept chef, and these intrepid home cooks now have to put their skills and palates on the line. Any mistake could cost them the competition, so with the pressure firmly on it promises to be a tense and thrilling affair. At the end, judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace will no doubt face a difficult decision.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the culinary delights of Provence in southern France. Starting out in Marseille, they meet a Moroccan woman who runs a welcome centre where immigrants can eat together - and who makes a fish stew to die for. Travelling west, they learn about the culinary influence of the Romans who conquered Europe 2,000 years ago, try a breakfast of pastry filled with spicy octopus, and dine with a Catalan farmer and his family on a regional speciality of barbecued snails.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A skier suffers a leg injury in a remote part of the Alps, so her guide tries to carry her to safety on his back. A girl calls 999 when her mum goes into anaphylactic shock.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Customers test and score an eco-lunchbox, an all-in-one waterproof coat for children and a cafetiere accessory that avoids having to scoop up the mushy grains when finished.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a foundry in France that produces iron pots and pans at the rate of one every five seconds, while Cherry Healey is in South Africa, at one of the world's largest iron ore mines, and rides in a giant dumper truck. Historian Ruth Goodman explains how cooking in pots has evolved, from communal ovens to 1970s slow cookers.(n)

programme.title: Kate Humble - Into the Volcano
programme.desc: Part two of two. Kate Humble joins a team of geologists on another research expedition in the southern Pacific as they head to the island of Ambrym in the Vanuatu archipelago. There she undertakes an arduous journey to the volcanic cone Marum - which contains one of only five lava lakes on the planet - abseiling right to its heart to discover if another major eruption may be imminent. Along the way she discovers how the volcano has shaped the customs and traditions of the islanders and discovers what it really means to live each day on its slopes.(n)

programme.title: Alex Polizzi: Chefs on Trial
programme.desc: The best three chefs from the week face their final challenge - to produce a three-course fine-dining menu for a restaurant full of customers, as well as managing a team of chefs who will be testing not only their cooking skills but also their ability to run a kitchen. At the end of the evening, the owners of The Gilpin and Alex Polizzi decide who will get the job.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Ronnie O'Sullivan v Barry Hawkins. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the final at the 2013 World Championship, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Michael Baggott are at Grittleton House in Wiltshire, where items include a valuable camera and a 19th-century tribal fighting club. Paul Martin visits a Victorian school that looks the same today as it did 100 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray compete in Double Points Friday, and their scores are tallied across the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Hardworking families across the UK who work around the clock to make their farms a success compete to win the much coveted and prestigious title of best farming family business at the British Farming Awards. Narrated by Denis Lawson.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Road to Mexico
programme.desc: The chef continues down the Californian coastline immortalised by John Steinbeck, a region of citrus groves and vineyards. On the edge of Los Angeles, Rick discovers Olvera Street, where the Hispanic origins of the city took root. Then heading south to San Diego, he meets 79-year-old Peter Halmay, the oldest sea-urchin diver in town, and is served the best fish chilli he has ever had by a local fishmonger.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The latest two highest-scoring chefs representing Wales cook their six-course menus again to impress judges Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The arbitrators are joined by actor David Bradley - Filch from the Harry Potter films - to help them determine who to send through to the national finals. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The green-fingered team guides team enthusiasts through seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Monty Don and faithful hounds Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow to bring inspiration as well as outline all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend. Cameras also travel the UK, visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Katherine Ryan and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at the theme 'Operations'. During the course of the show, the panellists find out how to turn a muffin into an offensive weapon. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: A self-isolated Nish Kumar hosts Britain's most uncompromising topical satire, tackling all the troubling news from a world that's put its faith in Boris Johnson and Donald Trump. His similarly quarantined correspondents include Rachel Parris, Geoff Norcott and Ellie Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Mini Mash Report
programme.desc: Highlights from the satirical news show, presented by Nish Kumar, as a cast of comedy correspondents give their take on the week's events.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, with Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Oranges and Sunshine
programme.desc: A social worker discovers that, over several decades, thousands of British children have been falsely informed their parents are dead and been forcibly sent to care homes in Australia, where they suffered terrible abuse. She devotes herself to exposing the scandal and helping the victims to find their families. Fact-based drama, with Emily Watson, Hugo Weaving and David Wenham.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Has The Government Failed The NHS? - Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines.(n)

programme.title: Cops Like Us
programme.desc: The Staffordshire Police officers look to the future as they take on new recruits, including trainee Holly Swift. After working in mental health services and seeing the difference police officers can make, she decided it was the career for her. At the other end of the career path is Sgt Dave Allan - who is just about to complete 30 years' service and retire. The police service recruited heavily after the miners' strikes in the 1980s, and many of those officers are now approaching retirement, including Dave.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood show clips from the natural world, including an elephant seal that turned up on a zebra crossing in Rio de Janeiro and a moose stuck up a tree.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: The most unusual places in the UK.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Joe Tracini and Meryl Fernandes enlist expert designers and builders to construct dream dens for lucky youngsters.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Long-running children's magazine programme.(n)

programme.title: Monsters vs Aliens: Mutant Pumpkins from Outer Space
programme.desc: Halloween-themed spin-off from DreamWorks' blockbuster animated movie. Aliens disguise themselves as pumpkins as part of a fiendish plot to take over the world - but Susan Murphy and her team of monsters are ready to fight back. With the voices of Reese Witherspoon, Seth Rogen and Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the crew head to Sri Lanka in search of dangerous predators, hunting for blue whales and tracking down Asian elephants. Along the way they encounter two deadly snakes, a venomous Russell's viper and the enormous Indian rock python.(n)

programme.title: Astronauts: Do You Have What It Takes
programme.desc: The remaining candidates head to a secret facility in Sweden. There they are deliberately deprived of oxygen to see if they can recognise the signs of hypoxia, critical for an astronaut on a spacewalk. Their ability to withstand the strong G-forces of space travel is also tested in a human centrifuge.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to Japan where she visits inventor and vet Dr Keiichi Ueda. The vet has dedicated the past 12 years of his career to helping a dolphin called Fuji who has no tail as a result of a bacterial infection and he is hoping that a new prosthetic tail will enable her to swim properly again. Steve Leonard heads to the rainforest of Laos, where Edinburgh Zoo vet Romain Pizzi is undertaking keyhole surgery on an endangered moon bear called Champa who suffers from excess fluid on her brain. Steve then visits Florida where reptile specialist Doug Mader is using the latest technology to save Martha, an alligator with a badly blocked gut. Clare and Steve also follow the stories of a Galapagos tortoise with a mystery illness, a five-ton elephant suffering from an infected tusk and a tiger that keeps having nose bleeds.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The wildlife of the Highlands, seen through the eyes of naturalist Fergus Beeley, who spent a year at Loch Maree and the surrounding hills. He follows the fortunes of rare black-throated divers and white-tailed sea eagles, and films the red deer and salmon whose lives revolve around the loch.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Susan Calman presents as the Welsh chefs serve up their starters and fish courses inspired by children's literature, including an homage to the legend of Twrch Trwyth and an ode to Roald Dahl. The chefs' fate depends on the scores they receive from their veteran and, with one person leaving after the fish course, nerves are running high. With some surprising scores all round, who will be eliminated from the competition and not cook their entire menu? The pressure is on for all the chefs to deliver.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Susan Calman presents as the Welsh chefs serve up their mains and desserts inspired by children's literature. The dishes include a Boggis, Bunce and Bean Farmers' Supper based on Fantastic Mr Fox, a guinea fowl inspired by the legend of Welsh dragon Y Ddraig Goch, a Willy Wonka golden egg and a simple marmalade sandwich in homage to everyone's favourite bear from darkest Peru, Paddington.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Neil Robertson v Judd Trump. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the quarter-final at the 2014 World Championship, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Talking Snooker
programme.desc: Alistair McGowan looks at the players who helped increase the sport's popularity, including Steve Davis, Stephen Hendry and Dennis Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The contestants are asked to insert an invisible zip and pockets on a pair of palazzo pants, while the judges keep a keen eye on how well they pattern-match the bold prints. For the transformation challenge, the sewers must turn towels into stylish beach cover-ups in just 90 minutes. Male models arrive in the Sewing Room for the final challenge, ready to be fitted with a made-to-measure holiday shirt using bright and colourful fabrics. Whose shirt will bring on the sunshine, and who will be sent packing?(n)

programme.title: We're Doomed! The Dad's Army Story
programme.desc: Comedy drama based on the story of how Jimmy Perry and David Croft brought the sitcom Dad's Army to life. Running from Perry's initial idea in 1967 until the transmission of the first episode in 1968, the film shows the beginnings of their writing partnership and the casting woes, personal clashes and production difficulties that put the show's existence in jeopardy. Starring Paul Ritter and Richard Dormer.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Mainwaring's Home Guard heroes try to raise money for the local Spitfire fund by having a bash at morris dancing for a carnival. Meanwhile, Jones is worried that Mrs Fox is falling for the town clerk, so he asks the captain if he can help. Classic comedy first broadcast in 1974, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier and Clive Dunn.(n)

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tours the imperial city of Hue, crosses the former demilitarised zone that once separated North from South Vietnam, and takes a boat ride on the Red River Delta. Approaching Vietnamese capital Hanoi aboard the Unification Railway, Michael passes the famous street where the locomotive passes within centimetres of the houses either side of the tracks. He also visits a former Soviet factory that once supplied military uniforms to the North Vietnamese army and Viet Cong, which now makes sportswear for the United States Olympic team. He ends this leg at the limestone islets and turquoise waters of Halong Bay.(n)

programme.title: The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society
programme.desc: In London, 1946, author Juliet Ashton's career has taken off but she is not enjoying promoting her detective stories to eager audiences on a book tour. When she receives a letter from a Guernsey pig farmer inviting her to attend a meeting of his literary society, she eagerly accepts. What Juliet discovers about her new friends and their secrets leads to her staying on the island much longer than she planned. Drama, starring Lily James, Tom Courtenay and Katherine Parkinson.(n)

programme.title: Lee Miller - A Life on the Front Line
programme.desc: Lee Miller is one of the most remarkable female icons of the 20th century. A fashion model-turned-photographer, then later a war reporter, Miller chose to live life by her own rules. This documentary drama celebrates a subject who defied anyone who tried to pin her down, put her on a pedestal or pigeonhole her in any way. Often at odds with the morality of the day, she refused to be subjugated by the dominant male figures around her.(n)

programme.title: Spitfire Women
programme.desc: The story of the 168 female pilots who served in Britain's Air Transport Auxiliary - an organisation responsible for delivering aircraft to the RAF on the front lines of battle during the Second World War. Despite having no radio or navigation equipment, ATA pilots were expected to fly any kind of aircraft to the destinations where they were most needed, often risking their lives in the process. The film also features interviews with the last surviving female veterans, who speak about the dangers they encountered in the skies and the discrimination they faced back home.(n)

programme.title: 8 Minutes Idle
programme.desc: A lazy call centre employee is thrown out of the house by his parents, and with nowhere else to go, starts secretly living in the office. As his life spirals out of control and everyone turns against him, he is forced to rethink his selfish behaviour to get back on track. Comedy based on Matt Thorne's novel, starring Tom Hughes and Antonia Thomas.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton, Danny Clarke and the team turn a boring and unused deck in Tredegar, south Wales, into a stylish and low-maintenance outdoor room, complete with hand-made furniture.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: With the country still in lockdown, Matt Baker is on his home patch, building a pond, meeting a peregrine that lacks the confidence to hunt, and getting crafty with the paintbrushes in his back garden. Wildlife film-maker Jack Perks reveals the world beneath the water of his garden pond, Adam Henson has a lot a lot of hungry mouths to feed on his farm, and Kate Humble takes viewers round her home village to find out how the community is pulling together in these challenging times.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The green-fingered team guides team enthusiasts through seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Monty Don and faithful hounds Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow to bring inspiration as well as outline all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend. Cameras also travel the UK, visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success.(n)

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: How rural businesses are changing to cope with Covid-19 and a report on the fast-growing sport of ‘canicross' - running with your dog.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: The team makes creative gardening use of the contents of our bins and answers viewers' gardening questions via a virtual Q&A.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Highlights from throughout the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The latest two highest-scoring chefs representing Wales cook their six-course menus again to impress judges Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The arbitrators are joined by actor David Bradley - Filch from the Harry Potter films - to help them determine who to send through to the national finals. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: Odette
programme.desc: The French widow of an English soldier offers her services to British Intelligence, and is sent undercover as a spy in Nazi-occupied France. However, her work alongside the resistance leads to her falling into the clutches of the Gestapo. Fact-based Second World War drama, with Anna Neagle, Trevor Howard, Peter Ustinov and Marius Goring.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Steve Davis v Dennis Taylor. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the 1985 World Championship final, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: The Crucible: 40 Golden Snooker Years
programme.desc: Steve Davis goes back to the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield to celebrate 40 years of the world snooker championship, talking to some of the players forever ingrained in the sport's history. The venue has become the home of snooker since the championships moved there in 1977, helping to create memorable moments and scenes of drama that live on to this day. Featuring interviews with former champions Stephen Hendry and Dennis Taylor, six-time runner-up and fans' favourite Jimmy White, and celebrity snooker addicts Richard Osman and Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison create virtual reality redesigns for a spacious Wiltshire home that used to be a hair salon - so is poorly designed for actually living in, with a ground floor that feels like two separate properties, each with its own front door. Laura gives the building a welcoming entrance while making the interior family-friendly and functional, while Robert comes up with an innovative approach that cuts down on the amount of floor space but which could radically alter the way the owners live.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a liqueur factory in Ireland that produces 540,000 bottles a day. He tracks the journey of a bottle of cream liqueur through the three-year production timeline. At the other end of the journey, Cherry Healey discovers where the empty bottles are recycled. Plus, historian Ruth Goodman visits a monastery to discover the spiritual origins of liqueurs.(n)

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon explores the eastern Mediterranean, beginning in Cyprus, where he goes on patrol with UN peacekeepers overseeing an abandoned buffer zone. He moves on to Lebanon, where he discovers the roots of Christianity, and Israel, where he boards a navy vessel guarding the country's offshore oil reserves. Finally, he crosses the world's most heavily fortified borders into Gaza, where he meets a woman helping reconstruction efforts by making bricks into ash.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five teams are reunited and look back on their journey, recalling the highs and lows, and sharing memories of the people who helped them along the way. They also reveal what their first impressions of each other were, and how those views were changed by the challenges they all had to face.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: Stacey Dooley Investigates: The Whale Hunters
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley investigates the controversial world of whale hunting. She witnesses commercial hunting first hand aboard a Norwegian vessel, as well as meeting people from the Faroe Islands in the North Atlantic, who still practice ancient hunting traditions which they argue are environmentally sustainable. She also talks to activists opposed to whale hunting, who have acquired video evidence of animals in distress.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: America's Most Dangerous Pets (?)
programme.desc: The World Wildlife Fund claims there are now more tigers in captivity in America than there are living wild in the rest of the world. Armed with this statistic, Louis Theroux travels stateside to meet people who give house space to animals normally found in Africa and Asia, including big cats and dangerous primates. Among the owners he meets is Joe Exotic, a policeman-turned-animal rescuer who has bred and collected more than 150 tigers, and Connie Casey, who shares her home with her 'family' of 20 chimpanzees.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: While Laszlo is transformed into a bat, he is mistaken for a real one by animal control officers, and needs his housemates to come to the rescue. Nadja gives in to temptation and seeks to be reunited with the reincarnation of her former lover.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The Baron awakens from his deathly slumber, and demands the other vampires show him the wonders of life in the New World - so the housemates treat him to a night out in Manhattan. Supernatural sitcom, starring Kayvan Novak, Matt Berry and Natasia Demetriou.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Istanbul
programme.desc: Journalist Adrian Chiles, former politician Edwina Currie, Olympian Fatima Whitbread, broadcaster Mim Shaikh, TV presenter Amar Latif, comedian Dom Joly and actress Pauline McLynn set out to cover sections of the Sultans Trail - a modern-day 2,200km pilgrimage across Eastern Europe that starts in Vienna and ends in Istanbul. Each has varying religions, with Dom and Pauline confirmed atheists. Starting in Serbia's capital Belgrade, they stay in basic hostels and sleep in shared dorms, acting as simple pilgrims traversing the ancient military route by rail and foot.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles recounts the story of a young woman who slipped and fell near the top of Snowdon in atrocious weather conditions, prompting Mountain Rescue to battle 100mph winds to save her. Plus, how paramedics fought to save the life of a cardiac patient whose heart stopped three times on the way to hospital.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Customers test and score a brush for pets, a storage solution for tin cans and a versatile, mouldable plastic stick that can be shaped into various kinds of tool. Presented by Lucy Alexander.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The final stage of the culinary contest begins, with the four remaining contestants embarking on a culinary adventure of a lifetime on the island of Mauritius, where they will face three extraordinary challenges. The first challenge takes place in the town of Mahebourg, one of the island's earliest established fishing ports. Split into teams of two, each pair will be tasked with cooking two traditional Mauritian street food dishes for local fishermen. Next, the amateurs travel to the island's capital, Port Louis, where they have the honour of working at the Labourdonnais hotel during a busy lunch service. Finally, the contestants face the daunting challenge of creating a dinner for mentors Chef Moroogun Coopen and Chef Peeroo Nizam, as well as some of the leading figures in Mauritius' food and cultural community.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's proceedings in Parliament, presented by Alicia McCarthy.(n)

programme.title: Home Front Heroes
programme.desc: Five famous faces reflect on the wartime experiences of close family members, discovering just how significant their contributions were. In the first edition actress Sue Johnston follows in the footsteps of her Auntie May, who was a nurse in Merseyside during the Second Word War.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Judd Trump v Stuart Bingham. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the semi-final at the 2015 World Championship, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Churchill
programme.desc: Documentary series, first shown in 1992, profiling the British war leader's life from his birth in 1874 to his inauguration as Prime Minister in May 1940. It explains the events that moulded the ambitious young politician and transformed him from a political failure in 1915 to the choice of the majority as the only leader able to stand up to Adolf Hitler.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives for party food, including Lorraine Pascale's white chocolate lollipops, seafood dishes by James Martin and Rachel Khoo's coq-au-vin on a stick.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott takes Len Goodman on a road trip around Britain to expand the Strictly Come Dancing judge's culinary horizons. The pair begin in Manchester, where Len has his first taste of Chinese food and samples some Mexican mezcal, while Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a stir-fried beef dish inspired by the day's adventures.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Five experts assess items brought to the Blickling estate in Norfolk, with David Harper excited by an early device for watching films, while David Fletcher and James Lewis reminisce about Rupert the Bear books and Dinky toys. Paul Martin enjoys a ride in a tank on historic former military camp.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon, Clive Myrie, Sara Pascoe and Rick Edwards test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week, with the daily winner declared following a quick-fire round at the end of the show.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Two farming families hope their much-loved pygmy goats will bring them acclaim at the Mid Devon Show, but the competition is tough and there is a record number of goats in the ring.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Generation
programme.desc: The extraordinary stories of some of the British men and women who fought or lived through the Second World War, now in their nineties or older. The first episode looks at how national unity was tested in the 1920s and 30s with class conflict, soaring unemployment and widespread civil unrest, but despite these upheavals, those growing up in the inter-war years remember much that was positive about life in Britain at the time. When war broke out in 1939, the men and women of this generation were ready to risk their lives for their country, but the evacuation of the British Army from the beaches of Dunkirk was a wake-up call for those expecting a swift victory.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the Grand Final as six contenders return to the black chair to decide which of them will be crowned champion. They answer questions of the specialist subjects of the Stonewall Riots, the ancient universities of Scotland, the Wars of the Roses, the No 1 Ladies' Detective Agency books, Johannes Vermeer, and the films of Kevin Smith, before having two minutes each to demonstrate their general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry and doctor and broadcaster Michael Mosley join an Imperial College, London, experiment to assess the brainpower of the nation, putting members of the public to the test in a battle of wits as they pit young and old, males and females, and tech lovers and readers against one other. The results reveal new science about how people's intelligence changes through their lives, while Hannah and Michael examine groundbreaking new science on how lifestyle and love of technology is changing the human brain.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition of the quiz, with Sandi Toksvig inviting Nish Kumar, David Mitchell and Aisling Bea to join regular panellist Alan Davies to face her fiendish questions about quads and quins. As usual, the host doesn't particularly care whether the answers are right or not, so long as they are interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: The $50m Art Swindle
programme.desc: Documentary telling the remarkable story of a charlatan art dealer who swindled more than $50million from the art establishment before going on the run. Michel Cohen, a popular and charming New York art dealer originally from France, was a high-school drop-out from a poor background who went on to become a rich and successful art dealer. Throughout the 1990s, he sold paintings by artists such as Picasso, Monet and Chagall to America's wealthiest elite. Cohen was living the high life until he began trading recklessly in the stock market and ran up considerable debts. In an attempt to recoup his losses, he swindled private collectors, auction houses and other art dealers out of more than $50million. When his crimes were discovered, he fled the US with his wife and two children and went on the run. In 2003, he was found by Interpol in Brazil and was imprisoned in Rio de Janeiro, but seven months later while awaiting extradition to the US, he escaped from prison and vanished off the face o.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints another signature landscape, featuring a mountain, cabin and meadow, as seen through a window.(n)

programme.title: Museums in Quarantine
programme.desc: Art historian Janina Ramirez takes a virtual tour of the British Museum, whose galleries she has paced since she was a girl. Here she highlights objects as varied as an Aztec decorated skull, ancient Egyptian cat mummies and an 18th-century tea set.(n)

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: A penniless orphan is chosen by a reclusive spinster to be a playmate for her cold-hearted ward, whom he falls in love with. As he grows up, a mysterious benefactor offers him the chance to rise into high society, but dark secrets lie behind both the object of his adoration and his newfound fortune. Period drama based on Charles Dickens' novel, starring Jeremy Irvine, Helena Bonham Carter, Ralph Fiennes and Holliday Grainger.(n)

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: The critic examines techniques and conventions behind science fiction films, including 2001: A Space Odyssey, Blade Runner, Arrival, Gravity and one of his favourites, Silent Running. He argues that for all their spectacle, sci-fi films ultimately derive their power from being about us.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Scientists and doctors investigate the properties of human hair and examine the methods and results of research done for business that are developing hair care products. They reveal whether or not it is worth splashing out on expensive shampoos and also uncover the special ingredients found in conditioners, and lay bare the secrets of the shiny, glossy hair seen in adverts.(n)

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc: The second documentary examining fictional writing from three different perspectives considers the subject of race and colonialism. It looks at books including Robinson Crusoe, the first novel ever published in English, in 1719, whose hero was a slave trader, and two famous American novels published more than a century apart - Harriet Beecher Stowe's Uncle Tom's Cabin and Toni Morrison's Beloved. The programme also comes up to date with titles such as Malorie Blackman's Noughts and Crosses and Paul Beatty's The Sell Out.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: Arena: Nicolas Roeg - It's About Time
programme.desc: Profile of the acclaimed director of Don't Look Now, The Man who Fell to Earth, Walkabout and Performance. Roeg reflects on the recurring themes of his work, including perception of time and the difficulty of human relationships. With contributions from actors Donald Sutherland, Julie Christie, Jenny Agutter and Theresa Russell, and film-makers who have been inspired by his work, including Danny Boyle and Ben Wheatley.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints another signature landscape, featuring a mountain, cabin and meadow, as seen through a window.(n)

programme.title: Museums in Quarantine
programme.desc: Art historian Janina Ramirez takes a virtual tour of the British Museum, whose galleries she has paced since she was a girl. Here she highlights objects as varied as an Aztec decorated skull, ancient Egyptian cat mummies and an 18th-century tea set.(n)

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: The critic examines techniques and conventions behind science fiction films, including 2001: A Space Odyssey, Blade Runner, Arrival, Gravity and one of his favourites, Silent Running. He argues that for all their spectacle, sci-fi films ultimately derive their power from being about us.(n)

programme.title: Virtuoso Violinists at the BBC
programme.desc: From the Royal Academy of Music Museum in London, Nicola Benedetti explores 60 years of BBC archive to celebrate the world of the violin and its most outstanding performers. From Nathan Milstein, Mischa Elman and Isaac Stern to Yehudi Menuhin, Itzhak Perlman and Nigel Kennedy, the presenter offers a violinist's perspective on what makes a great performance in a tradition that stretches back to the 19th-century virtuoso Paganini.(n)

programme.title: Tunes for Tyrants: Music & Power with Suzy Klein
programme.desc: Suzy reaches the 1930s, when the totalitarian dictators sought to use and abuse music for ideological ends. She looks at the lives of Richard Strauss, Dmitri Shostakovich and Sergei Prokofiev, who produced some of the 20th-century's best-loved music whilst navigating the precarious tightrope of working for perhaps the most terrifying music lovers ever - Hitler and Stalin. The political message of the classic musical fairy tale Peter and the Wolf is revealed as well as the secret code hidden in Shostakovich's quartets and Strauss's deeply personal reasons for trying to please the Nazis.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Steve Wright and Jenny Powell host the edition first shown on August 3, featuring performances by Martika, Paul McCartney, Transvision Vamp, Lightning Seeds, Kylie Minogue, Shakespears Sister and Jive Bunny and the Mastermixers..(n)

programme.title: The Shadows at Sixty
programme.desc: From where they began as the Drifters to the backing band for Cliff Richard, and on to their huge success as the Shadows, this documentary celebrates the band's achievements across 60 years in what has been a time of constant change within social, cultural and musical landscapes. The Shadows were at the forefront of the UK beat boom generation and the first backing band to emerge as big stars in their own right and this programme features unseen archive, personal testimony, interviews with Cliff Richard, band members Hank Marvin, Bruce Welch and Brian Bennett and some of those they influenced, including Brian May, David Gilmour and Pete Townshend. Narrated by Gina McKee.(n)

programme.title: Great Guitar Riffs at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of archive clips and performances which include some of the most memorable guitar riffs of all time. Featuring Jimi Hendrix, the Kinks, Cream, AC/DC, the Smiths, Rage Against the Machine, Radiohead, Foo Fighters, Pixies and the Stone Roses.(n)

programme.title: Elton John Live at Hyde Park
programme.desc: The singer performs a concert in London's Hyde Park to a crowd of 50,000 fans, as the headlining act of Radio 2's Festival in a Day event. The show features old favourites from Elton's five-decade career, as well as songs from his recent studio album Wonderful Crazy Night, on which he and Bernie Taupin, the songwriter behind many of his greatest hits, worked together for the first time in nearly 10 years.(n)

programme.title: People's History of Pop
programme.desc: Twiggy celebrates the decade from 1955, when the pop music fan was born, hearing from fans of the era. The stories uncovered include a young Lonnie Donegan admirer inviting the singer back to a friend's house where they enjoyed an impromptu skiffle jam, and a schoolgirl's whose dream came true when the Beatles turned up at the pub where her mother was a waitress. Plus, the experiences of those lucky to attend a recording of legendary music show Ready, Steady, Go!(n)

programme.title: The Shadows at Sixty
programme.desc: From where they began as the Drifters to the backing band for Cliff Richard, and on to their huge success as the Shadows, this documentary celebrates the band's achievements across 60 years in what has been a time of constant change within social, cultural and musical landscapes. The political message of the classic musical fairy tale Peter and the Wolf is revealed as well as the secret code hidden in Shostakovich's quartets and Strauss's deeply personal reasons for trying to please the Nazis.(n)

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a programme looking at the family of mammals, beginning by revealing the extraordinary strategies monkeys, apes and lemurs must use to survive in the most unexpected places. In South Africa, rarely seen bush babies go in search of food in the lean times of winter, while times are also hard for a troop of bearded capuchins in Brazil's scorched badlands.(n)

programme.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer explores how the American wilderness shaped the Wild West. He begins by looking at the landscapes of three great mountain ranges - the Appalachians, the Rockies and the Sierra Nevada - and how they challenged the westward push of early pioneers. He discovers how their geography, extreme weather, wild animals and ecology provided both opportunities and challenges for those living there, and also experiences mule-trekking and gold prospecting.(n)

programme.title: State of Happiness
programme.desc: It is December 1969 and international oil companies are pulling out of Stavanger in Norway after years of test drilling without success. Christian Nyman works as a diver on one of the rigs, while Toril Torstensen's American boyfriend works for Shell, but what happens next affects everyone in town. Starring Anne Regine Ellingsaeter, Amund Harboe, Toril Torstensen and Bart Edwards. In Norwegian and English.(n)

programme.title: State of Happiness
programme.desc: Phillips Petroleum introduces a smoking ban on the Ocean Viking rig, while the mayor of Stavanger speculates on whether the Americans might have found oil. Toril Torstensen makes an unavoidable choice. In Norwegian and English.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Music compilation show celebrating some of the most popular boy bands to have graced TV screens since the 1960s. The programme highlights performances by acts defined by vocal harmonies, synchronised dance-steps and character appeal, including JLS, the Four Tops, the Monkees, Westlife, Village People and Blazin' Squad.(n)

programme.title: Slade at the BBC
programme.desc: Noddy Holder introduces a compilation of the band's performances from the BBC archives. Featuring appearances from the 1970s on shows such as Top of the Pops, Blue Peter and Crackerjack, with classic hits including Coz I Luv You, Mama Weer All Crazee Now and Cum on Feel the Noize.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Steve Wright and Jenny Powell host the edition first shown on August 3, featuring performances by Martika, Paul McCartney, Transvision Vamp, Lightning Seeds, Kylie Minogue, Shakespears Sister and Jive Bunny and the Mastermixers..(n)

programme.title: Our Musical History
programme.desc: Country duo Ben Earle and Crissie Rhodes reveal the songs that shaped their musical journey. They begin with Dolly Parton's iconic track Jolene. Following that comes Patsy Cline, as Crissie recalls singing along to Crazy with her grandmother. Ben then picks country-pop crossover Shania Twain, whose That Don't Impress Me Much certainly made its mark on him. He also plumps for Glen Campbell's legendary Wichita Lineman. The pair also cite critically acclaimed duo the Civil Wars and their spine-tingling live appearance on Later - with Jools Holland.(n)

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a programme looking at the family of mammals, beginning by revealing the extraordinary strategies monkeys, apes and lemurs must use to survive in the most unexpected places. In South Africa, rarely seen bush babies go in search of food in the lean times of winter, while times are also hard for a troop of bearded capuchins in Brazil's scorched badlands.(n)

programme.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer explores how the American wilderness shaped the Wild West. He begins by looking at the landscapes of three great mountain ranges - the Appalachians, the Rockies and the Sierra Nevada - and how they challenged the westward push of early pioneers. He discovers how their geography, extreme weather, wild animals and ecology provided both opportunities and challenges for those living there, and also experiences mule-trekking and gold prospecting.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Musician
programme.desc: Five young musicians compete in the keyboard final for a place in the BBC Young Musician 2020 semi-finals, performing works by Bach, Scarlatti, Beethoven and Rachmaninov. Presented by organist and conductor Anna Lapwood, the category finals were filmed in March at the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama, and Anna is joined by Leon McCawley, one of the UK's foremost pianists and professor of piano at the Royal Academy of Music, to cast their eyes over each performance.(n)

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: The changes that have swept across the Arabian peninsula since the discovery of oil. Camel racing has become a hi-tech sport and the region's animals now live alongside a very modern society, but technology is also being used to protect nature. The programme reveals how dugongs are fitted with satellite transmitters and hunting falcons chase down radio-controlled planes, and follows the construction of the world's first carbon-neutral city. Narrated by Alexander Siddig.(n)

programme.title: David Stratton's Stories of Australian Cinema
programme.desc: The critic tells the story of Australian movie-making, focusing on the films that capture this idiosyncratic nation with drama, emotion and humour. This episode sees how Aussie film-makers gained the confidence to tell their own stories with the boldness of Picnic at Hanging Rock and Mad Max, the global success of Crocodile Dundee and Shine, the flamboyance of Strictly Ballroom and the raw authenticity of Samson and Delilah.(n)

programme.title: Retreat: Meditations from a Monastery
programme.desc: The Slow TV strand returns, allowing viewers to immerse themselves in the tranquil lives of monks in three Benedictine monasteries, beginning with Downside Abbey in Somerset. It is home to 14 Benedictine monks who live according to the sixth-century Rule of St Benedict and this episode follows two of the monks over the course of a typical, quiet monastic day, as they engage with carpentry and baking, religious services and moments of private prayer in the monastery gardens.(n)

programme.title: Wise Children
programme.desc: A performance of Emma Rice's ebullient theatrical production of Angela Carter's deliciously dark final novel, a story of twins from a dysfunctional family who pursue a career performing as showgirls. Filmed live at the York Theatre Royal in 2019.(n)

programme.title: Angela Carter: Of Wolves and Women
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the life and career of the novelist, whose surreal imagination produced some of the most dazzling fiction of the 20th century. While Carter's early work drew on her claustrophobic childhood and miserable early marriage, it was her experience of living in Japan in the 1970s that liberated both her writing and her sexuality. The film includes rare archive footage and family photos, with contributions from Angela's friends, family and admirers - including Margaret Atwood, Salman Rushdie, Jeanette Winterson and Anne Enright. Narrated by Sally Phillips.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Musician
programme.desc: Five young musicians compete in the keyboard final for a place in the BBC Young Musician 2020 semi-finals, performing works by Bach, Scarlatti, Beethoven and Rachmaninov. Presented by organist and conductor Anna Lapwood, the category finals were filmed in March at the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama, and Anna is joined by Leon McCawley, one of the UK's foremost pianists and professor of piano at the Royal Academy of Music, to cast their eyes over each performance.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a cool blue waterway winding effortlessly from the far away high peaks and evergreens in a mountain landscape.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how having a skeleton has helped vertebrates to colonise and dominate almost every habitat on Earth. He begins his journey by looking at the influence of bones on size, revealing how they are capable of supporting large animals, with the strongest bone able to withstand 109 tons of pressure.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
programme.desc: The professor delves deeper into ordinary Roman life by going behind the closed doors of the family home. She tells the stories of eccentric wife Glyconis - praised by her husband for liking a drink or two - Allia Potestas, who lived in a menage a trois, and 11-year-old schoolboy Sulpicius Maximus, worked to death by his pushy parents. Mary also paints a more detailed picture of slavery, revealing that many Romans chose to be buried with their servants.(n)

programme.title: Ian Hislop's Fake News: A True History
programme.desc: The Private Eye editor explores the history of dishonest news reporting over the past 200 years, investigating how the rivalry between press barons Joseph Pulitzer and William Randolph Hearst may have contributed to an actual war. The programme also looks at the influence of technology, from early trick photography to modern deepfakes, and features the owner of a Washington pizza parlour who has been on the receiving end of one of the modern world's most infamous conspiracy theories.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.desc: Sam Willis concludes his exploration of the criminal underworld of the 17th and 18th centuries by looking at urban crime, fraud and corruption, uncovering a fascinating rogues' gallery of villains. He examines the case of thief and serial escaper Jack Sheppard, who was so notorious that almost a quarter of a million people turned up to witness his hanging, while fraudster Mary Toft managed to convince George I's surgeon that she had given birth to rabbits.(n)

programme.title: Elegance and Decadence: The Age of the Regency
programme.sub-title: Warts and All - Portrait of a Prince
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores how British culture was transformed between 1811 and 1820, the period known as the Regency era. She begins by profiling George, the Prince Regent, and charts how his rivalry with Napoleon served as a catalyst for change and led to the development of a grandiose architectural style that changed the face of London.(n)
